definition: to show no understanding of the times (idiom); cannot adapt to current circumstances/not amenable to reason
affair/business/matter/to be engaged in/to attend to/by all means

sentences.english: They put a few posters on the wall.
sentences.chinese: 這是一些不識時務的意見。

sentences.english: This is the opinions of some rip van winkle .
sentences.chinese: 這是一些不識時務的意見。

sentences.english: They regarded me as "old-fashioned" and behind the times.
sentences.chinese: 他們認爲我老“土”，不識時務。

sentences.english: This is the opinions of some Rip Van Winkle.
sentences.chinese: 這是一些不識時務的意見。

sentences.english: This is the opinion of some Rip van Winkle.
sentences.chinese: 這是一些不識時務者的意見。

sentences.english: One of the most common grievances aired at politicians is that they are out of touch.
sentences.chinese: 說到政客，人們最常抱怨的便是他們的不識時務。

sentences.english: This is the opinion of some Rip Van Winkle .
sentences.chinese: 這是一些不識時務的意見。
